ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: By taking this course, I developed a lot of knowledge on how to deal with different situations that might occur during archaeological fieldwork.
Skills regarding planning and executing one's own excavation for research survey skills documentation development of research and execution of specialists

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The professor has organised the course in a very engaging way that each class was interesting and fruitful.

Really great course regarding actual examples of on-site excavation Interaction with specialists of different kinds that work on these excavations Interaction and open-discussion regarding excavation issues and problems Maybe more hands-on experience with a mock planning of an excavation

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would definately recommend taking this course for graduate students, who will be organizing their fieldwork in the future.
Yes; Very good for getting first hand accounts of issues faced during actual excavations, and an opportunity to learn how to nominate a potential site for UNESCO or World Heritage.
